channel.title: 英语 on 飞璠博客
channel.description: Recent content in 英语 on 飞璠博客

item.title: 单词(2023-2.25-3.4)
item.description:
2023 2.25

Once upon a time, in the kingdom of Meganeton, there lived a brave and untamed prince. He was determined to ascertain the truth behind a long-standing dispute between his kingdom and its neighboring kingdom.

The prince was a brilliant scientist and he decided to pursue the matter using the latest scientific methods. He built a solenoid, a device that uses an electric current to create a magnetic field, to measure the viability of the mass medium between the two kingdoms.

He also used a logie, a device that measures the speed of sound, to measure the resonant frequency of the mass medium. He then used an insulator and coaxial cable to protect the device from interference.

The prince was intrigued when his experiment revealed that the mass medium was anisotropic, meaning it had different properties in different directions. He suspected that this was the source of the dispute.

To further investigate, the prince used a retarder, a device that slows down the speed of sound, to see if the properties of the mass medium could be changed. He then used cellophane to cover the retarder and see if it changed the properties of the mass medium.

The prince was delighted to find that the cellophane had indeed changed the properties of the mass medium. He was finally able to ascertain the truth behind the long-standing dispute and bring peace between the two kingdoms.

2023 2.26

Once upon a time there lived a boorish prince who was always befuddling the courtiers with his austere attitude. He was so cajoling that no one could ever guess what he was thinking. He was known for his candor but his words were so sharp that they often left people exhausted.

One day, the prince decided to test the courtiers by giving them a difficult problem. He asked them to solve a combinatorial problem that involved partitioning a set of bolts into pairwise disjoint sets with different alleles. The courtiers were taken aback by the problem and tried their best to solve it but to no avail.

The prince, who was already in a bad mood, became even more frustrated and ordered them to solve the problem using the binomial axiom and an exhaustive search. The courtiers were now completely befuddled and exhausted. They had no idea how to proceed and begged the prince for mercy.

However, the prince was in no mood to show mercy and continued to insist that they solve the problem. After much cajoling, the courtiers finally managed to solve the problem and the prince was satisfied. However, their solution was not perfect and had a few defects.

The prince, who was known for his abstinence, refused to accept the solution and demanded that they find a perfect solution. The courtiers, who were already exhausted, had no choice but to try again. After a long and tedious search, they finally managed to find a perfect solution and the prince was pleased.

The courtiers had finally managed to solve the problem, much to their posterior!

2023 2.27

Once upon a time, there was a philanthropist named Mr. Smith who was also a trendsetter in the world of finance. He had a vast portfolio of investments, and he was always looking for new ways to maximize his returns. One day, he came across a mathematical concept known as bivariate quantile regression, which he found very intuitive and fascinating.

As he studied this concept further, he realized that it could be used to analyze the progression of consecutive data points in his investments. He hired a team of mathematicians to help him develop a model that would allow him to identify trends and patterns in his portfolio using bivariate quantile regression.

To his delight, he discovered that the model was also useful in the field of factorization. He found that he could use it to break down complex data sets into simpler components, which he could then analyze more easily.

However, Mr. Smith’s interest in this new mathematical tool soon drew the attention of others in the finance industry. His competitors began to use similar models to analyze their own portfolios, and soon, the concept of bivariate quantile regression became widely known and used.

As the popularity of this mathematical tool grew, a corollary emerged – a new trend in the world of finance that emphasized the importance of understanding and analyzing data through mathematical models. Mr. Smith was proud to have been a part of this trendsetting movement, but he also felt a vague sense of unease.

He realized that the unintended consequence of this movement was that it made the world of finance more decadent and exclusive. The hobo on the street had no access to these sophisticated mathematical tools, and he was left behind as the wealthy got even richer.

Mr. Smith struggled with this ethical dilemma, but he ultimately decided to continue using bivariate quantile regression in his work. He knew that the linearity and closure of mathematical models could never fully capture the complexity of human life, but he hoped that he could use this tool to make a positive impact on the world.

As he continued to use bivariate quantile regression in his work, Mr. Smith also became more involved in philanthropy. He used his wealth to support organizations that helped those who were less fortunate, hoping to balance out the unintended consequences of his work in finance.

In the end, Mr. Smith found solace in the fact that he was using his knowledge and resources to do good in the world, even if his work in finance had unintended consequences. He knew that there was no easy answer to the ethical questions that his work raised, but he hoped that he could continue to make a positive impact in his own small way.
